title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.25 | 22-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Now here is the most important part of the Mahabharata.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with the speaker introducing the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and highlighting the importance of the conversation between Yudhishthira and Bhishmadeva on Dharma in the Mahabharata.

segments.key_quote: So Bhishmadeva is the most authoritative personality to speak on religious principles.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes Bhishmadeva's authority on religious principles (Dharma) as one of the twelve Mahajanas, highlighting the confidential nature of Dharma and its understanding by great personalities.

segments.key_quote: Yudhishthira after the battle was over and he had won the Pandavas had won the battle but seeing the Massacre Yudhishthira was aggrieved and he could not be pacified by so many other saintly persons sages and even Krishna himself
segments.summary: This segment describes Yudhishthira's grief and remorse after the Kurukshetra war, emphasizing the magnitude of the massacre and how even Krishna couldn't pacify him, leading to Bhishmadeva's role in providing solace and guidance.

segments.key_quote: the liberated souls are not required to go by the principles of the Shastra of the Lord... because they are constantly in touch with Krishna within the heart
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna inspires both Yudhishthira and Bhishmadeva, highlighting Krishna's presence as Paramatma in everyone's heart and how liberated souls receive direct guidance from Krishna, making the Shastras primarily for conditioned souls.

segments.key_quote: Krishna inspired Yudhishthira to ask Bhishma Deva about the principles of religion and Krishna inspired Bhishma Deva to speak even though Bhishma was in a very very difficult situation
segments.summary: This section discusses Krishna's inspiration behind the conversation and Bhishma's unique benediction to choose the time of his death, contrasting it with the common experience of forced death when the lifespan is exhausted.

segments.key_quote: Bhagavad Gita is the complete knowledge for every human being on the surface of the earth in every aspect of their duties in different stages
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the perfection of life through Krishna consciousness and criticizes the superficial understanding of the Bhagavad Gita, asserting that it contains complete knowledge for all aspects of human life.

segments.key_quote: Lord Krishna wanted to prove that his pure devotee like Bhishmadeva is always sound in body and mind by dint of spiritual enlightenment.
segments.summary: This segment mentions the Dharma pertaining to the four varnas and ashramas, highlighting that the Bhagavad Gita contains the essence of these principles. It also explains that Krishna wanted to prove Bhishma's spiritual strength despite his physical condition.

segments.key_quote: See somebody is sent person Krishna conscious then irrespective of the condition of the body or the mind they are perfected.
segments.summary: The speaker uses Srila Prabhupada as an example of a devotee who, despite physical weakness, remained perfectly clear in consciousness and continued to give perfect knowledge, demonstrating the power of Krishna consciousness.

segments.key_quote: worship of his devotee is more valuable than the worship of Lord Krishna himself
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by reiterating that a devotee is always in perfect order to speak the right way of life. It also emphasizes Krishna's desire to glorify his devotees, highlighting that worship of devotees is more valuable than worship of Krishna himself, and Krishna inspired Yudhishthira to ask questions to Bhishma.
